intro: Cardamine hirsuta var. tetrandra, commonly known as the hairy watercress, is a variant of the broadleaf watercress species. It is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically found in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and woodland floors. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels and bloom in early spring. The plant is known for its peppery flavor and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
